label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple pale-yellow follicular papules, with few hyperpigmented papules over the flexor aspect of both upper extremities (1a, 1b), the chest, axilla, and forehead

label: Figure 2
caption: Histopathology with H and E (×10) and (×100) showing a mid-dermal cyst lined by thinly stretched epithelium, that lacks granular layer and has a corrugated lining in foci and abundant lamellated keratin and several vellus hair shafts are present within the cyst

label: Figure 1
caption: Multiple hyperpigmented follicular papules on flexural aspect of forearm

label: Figure 2
caption: Mid dermal cyst lined by flattened squamous epithelium [H & E, 10X]

label: Figure 3
caption: Cyst cavity containing laminated keratinous material and varying numbers of transversely and obliquely cut vellus hair shafts [H & E, 100X]

label: Fig. 1.
caption: Photographs showed an approximately 2 cm round, bulging mass on the patient’s nasal root. (A) Anterior-posterior view. (B) Worm’s eye view.

label: Fig. 2.
caption: Magnetic resonance imaging showed an approximately 1.3×2.2×2.2 cm T1 high signal intensity mass in the nasal root and low signal intensity in contrast enhanced fat-saturation T1 weight image. (A) T1 axial view and (B) contrast enhanced fat-saturation T1 axial view.

label: Fig. 3.
caption: Histopathological features of the excised tumor. (A) A cyst lined by stratified squamous epithelium (H&E, ×40). (B) Magnified view of the area within the rectangle in (A). A cyst lined by stratified squamous epithelium comprises laminated keratin (blue arrow) and a variable number of vellus hair shafts (light green arrows) (H&E, ×200).

label: Fig. 4.
caption: Photographs 6 months after surgery. (A) Anterior-posterior view. (B) Worm’s eye view.

label: Fig 1
caption: Scattered, multiple skin-colored to whitish papules on the right shoulder, upper portion of the right arm, right forearm, and chest. Hyperpigmented atrophic plaque on the right shoulder from the biopsy site.

label: Fig 2
caption: Dystrophic nails, with onycholysis, brachyonychia, and ragged cuticles.

label: Fig 3
caption: Camptomelia (bent limb) and rhizomelia (shortened limb) of the right lower extremity.

label: Fig 4
caption: Histopathologic result of the biopsy of a vellus hair cyst in a child with SWS. A middermal cyst lined with a stratified squamous epithelium and within the cystic lumen are multiple vellus hair shafts and laminated keratinaceous material. (hematoxylin-eosin stain; original magnification: ×40.)
